titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Julius Manson Papers WAG.164
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 16:33:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Julius Manson Papers

physdesc.extent: in 40 record cartons, 1 folder in a shared box and 1 folder in a flat-file drawer

did.abstract: Julius J. Manson (1907-1988) was a New York City professor and labor mediator and arbitrator. The Julius Manson Papers include notes, correspondence, publications, research materials, articles, and photographs and are primarily from the 1940s through the 1970s.
did.physloc: Materials stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Julius Manson Papers primarily relate to Manson's work as a professor and labor mediator and arbitrator. There are some materials related to his involvement in the movement for the international adoption of Esperanto. Materials include notes, correspondence, publications, research materials, articles, and photographs and are primarily from the 1940s through the 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Photographs were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Jules Manson Photographs (PHOTOS 176). In 2014, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Julius Manson Papers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Julius Manson Papers; WAG 164; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession numbers associated with this colletion are 1986.007, 1986.013 and NPA.2001.003.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1930-1998, are expected to enter the public domain in 2069.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Julius J. Manson (1907-1988) was a New York City professor and labor mediator and arbitrator. He received his JD from Brooklyn Law School in 1936 and his PhD in Economics from Columbia University in 1955. In the 1930s, he worked as an investigator for the New York State Labor Department, Division of Women in Industry and Minimum Wage. From the 1940s through the 1980s, Manson was a labor mediator for the New York State Board of Mediation. He also served as the Board's Executive Director during 1957-1959. In 1966-1967, he lived in Ankara and worked as an advisor to the Turkish Government on Labor Relations. Manson was a professor in the Department of Management at Baruch College during 1969-1977 and served as the Business School Dean in 1972-1974. He held the title of professor emeritus after 1977. He also taught labor studies courses at Columbia, New York University, the New School, and Cornell University. Additionally, he founded and was chair of the Labor-Management Luncheon Series at the New School for Social Research in the 1950s and 1960s.

Manson was involved with the international Esperanto movement, representing the Universal Esperanto Association of the United Nations in the 1980s and 1990s. He was a founding member of the Three Arrows Cooperative Society and served as its president during 1937-1938. His first wife, Minnie Kaplan, died in 1941. After World War II, he married Elizabeth Robinson Butzner.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

did.unittitle: Mixed pamphlets, related materials. Documents from the National Academy of Arbitrators NAA, National Center for the Study of Collective Bargaining in Higher Education (conference materials. directory). One arbitration case: Shell Co. & I.A.M.

Two labor arbitration cases: Shell & IAM, American Fed. of Government Employees. Documents from the National Center for Study of Coll. Bargaining, Old Timers labor fraternity. Faculty documents from Baruch College. Personal calendars (1960s).Mixed journals, pamphlets from the labor movement, UN.
Labor arbitration cases. Dissertation, school papers, notes (1950s). Autobiography of Carol Manson, papers of Minnie Kaplan. Socialist pamphlets, newsletters (1930s),labor law notes (1940s).

Documents on Turkey aid (1960s), trip to Turkey (primarily logistical). Adoption case, arbitration cases involving civic service, AF GE, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers. Documents irom Three Arrows Coop Society, NY State Board of Mediation. Minutes from National Committee for Rural Schools. Non-print items: photograph, pin.
New School bulletins (1950s), CUNY, Baruch College materials. Socialist pamphlets, labor newspaper clippings, materials (1960s). Correspondence primarily regarding labor mediation (1950s-1960s).
List of Manson's contacts. Turkey Aid documents. General correspondence (from1964). Labor arbitration case materials, bulk of which deals with AWOL and theftcase, Rivas case. Journals.

Personal materials, including Manson articles, lectures, speeches. Course documents, including course syllabi, correspondence with New School, graduate school papers, bulletins, UN World College documents. Newspaper clippings regarding labor(1940s-60s). Non-print items: photographs.

New York State Mediation Board: correspondence, notes, documents American Arbitration Association. Empire State College, Baruch College course materials. Correspondence (1975-76). One arbitration case: AFGE, I.N.S. Union pamphlets, including ILGW and WTUL.

Lt. Carlson case (Manson assisted in defense against Antisemitism charges. Socialist songbooks. Records of trip to Turkey (1960s). Turkish government contract. Labor arbitration cases including United Auto Workers, Federal Employees Metal Trades Council. Diego Rivera postcard set. Pamphlets. Non-print items include: pin, I.D. tags, audiotapes on seminars, meetings.

Labor relations, arbitration, mediation: correspondence, resumes, clippings, pamphlets. Turkey labor assistance reports, correspondence. Three Arrows membership list. New York State Dept. of Labor pamphlets.

Correspondence re: WPA strike (1935). Electrical Workers New Deal Group circulars. Book proposal: Labor Arbitration in the U.S. General arbitration correspondence. Appointment letter to NYU faculty. Biographical materials. Turkish Mediation, Arbitration Team correspondence. Newsletters, clippings. Handwritten manuscript on socialism by Algernon Lee. Arbitration memoranda. Non-print items: Photographs (mostly Manson).

Labor relations, law, education papers, pamphlets, clippings, notes, publications. Socialist Party pamphlet (1930). Radio program transcript on atom bomb. WWH Army correspondence and papers from Italian training institute (1945). Political writing by Manson (1948). National Conference for Clarifying the Constitution by Amendment Symposium paper (1937). Rand School of Social Science brochures. Personal correspondence and writings. Biographical materials. Papers re: Frank Schechter Estate. National Committee for Rural Schools correspondence. Passover and other religious booklets. American Veterans Committee paper. Non-print items: Marquee poster for Independent Labor Conference for G.I.s (c. 1948).

Labor relations, law, education papers, pamphlets, clippings, notes, publications. International Longshoremen and United Steelworkers labor disputes. League for Industrial Democracy brochures. International trade union information. New School papers.

Labor relations, education papers, pamphlets, clippings, notes, publications. National Committee for Rural Schools minutes, correspondence, luncheon programs, other materials. Baltimore desegregation pamphlet. League for Industrial Democracy, NAACP, and other educational reform materials. Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor regulations, papers. Student recommendations, term papers on engineering unions. National War Labor Board materials.

Personal correspondence. ERISA briefs (1979). Academic papers. New York State Board of Mediation materials. Maimonides Medical Center notes, correspondence. Hospital arbitration. District #65/Franklin Textiles arbitration materials.

NYS Board of Mediation agendas, case materials, correspondence, history, memos, minutes, notes, statistics. Clippings (1961). "The Crisis of the American Trade Union Movement," report by Solomon Barkin. Dept. of Labor annual reports and materials. Grievance procedure, managerial philosophy, ethical culture, and pamphlets. Urban League for Greater New York materials. Union newspapers. Labor law materials. Labor and Civil Rights materials. National Academy of Arbitrators publications.

Wollman Lecture materials. Taylor Law paper and materials — Oswego (1969). Rabin talk. Assoc. of Labor Mediation Agencies materials. Newspapers. "The Afﬂuent Afﬂiction" (speech). NY State Labor Relations Board briefs and materials. 1965 calendar pages. College-Level Examination Program Booklet. Mediation Study. Empire State Evaluation Data (1974). NYC Employee Relations Program report (1963). Pamphlets. Course materials. "Labor Relations at Columbia Univ." (paper). Grievance materials. Misc. correspondence and notes.

Turkey travel materials, notes, correspondence, pamphlets, reports. NY State Labor Relations Board briefs and materials. Clippings re: Men in Uniform. CUNY budget and materials. Institute for Labor Relations proposal (Baruch College). "What's New in Collective Bargaining Negotiations and Contracts" newsletters. UF CT documents. "Legislative Digest" reports. League for Industrial Democracy materials. "Jewish-American Unionism, Its Birth Pangs and Contribution to the General American Labor Movement" (pamphlet). Labor Mediation Exam (1954). Labor racketeering clippings.

Governor's Committee on Public Employee Relations Report (1968). National Committee for Rural Schools leaﬂet. Council Against Communist Aggression literature. Turkish materials.
